intro: Hieracium fuscum subsp. pseudoflammeum, commonly known as the false flame hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller and more compact flower heads compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
